page.title: 18HEMEL LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The local "Chiltern" accent has largely given way to the London/Cockney accent of the "New Town" influx of 1950's. An open market remains on a larger site in the new shopping area. The only remaining craft is Salter/Wilker baskets in Anchor Lane which occupied premises in the old High Street for nearly a century till 1975. Hay engineering occupies buildings next to the Fishery Inn on the Grand Union Canal which housed a blacksmith/farrier tha serviced the horses and boats. It remained largely unaltered till 1981 and retains many old features. The local building materials are grey brick and Knapped flint, but modern developments make no concession to this. Contemporary art/drama flourish at the Arts Centre and Old Town Hall.
